intro: Rhexia strigillosa, commonly known as the hairy leafhex, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded woodlands and has hairy stems and leaves, giving it its common name. Its blooms appear in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Rhexia strigillosa is often found in sandy or loamy soils and thrives in partial to full shade.
